jsoul.midi

Class MidiFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • jsoul.midi.MidiFile

  • public class MidiFile
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a MIDI file format, and provides an interface to read from and write to .mid files.
    Author:
    Andrew Goldin

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MidiFile()
      Default constructor: Defines a MIDI file named "output.mid".
      MidiFile(java.lang.String fileName)
      Constructs a new MIDI file object with the given filename.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void append(Sequence s)
      Appends a given Sequence to the end of an existing MIDI file, and writing the result to a new file.
      void clear()
      Clears the MIDI file of all content, if the file exists in the system.
      java.lang.String getFileName()
      Get the object's file name.
      Sequence getSequence()
      Will convert the file (if it exists in the system) into a jsoul-compatible Sequence that can be modified using jsoul's API.
      void setFileName(java.lang.String fileName)
      Set the desired file name of the MIDI file.
      void writeToFile(Chord c)
      Writes a single chord to a MIDI file, using the file name specified in the MidiFile's constructor.
      void writeToFile(Note n)
      Writes a single note to a MIDI file, using the file name specified in the MidiFile's constructor.
      void writeToFile(Sequence s)
      Writes a jsoul Sequence to a MIDI file, using the file name specified in the MidiFile's constructor.
      void writeToFile(Track t)
      Writes a single jsoul track to a MIDI file, using the file name specified in the MidiFile's constructor.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • MidiFile

        public MidiFile()
        Default constructor: Defines a MIDI file named "output.mid".

      • MidiFile

        public MidiFile(java.lang.String fileName)
        Constructs a new MIDI file object with the given filename.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the desired filename

    • Method Detail

      • setFileName

        public void setFileName(java.lang.String fileName)
        Set the desired file name of the MIDI file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the desired file name

      • getFileName

        public java.lang.String getFileName()
        Get the object's file name.
        Returns:
        the file name

      • writeToFile

        public void writeToFile(Note n)
        Writes a single note to a MIDI file, using the file name specified in the MidiFile's constructor.
        Parameters:
        n - the Note to be written

      • writeToFile

        public void writeToFile(Chord c)
        Writes a single chord to a MIDI file, using the file name specified in the MidiFile's constructor.
        Parameters:
        c - the Chord to be written

      • writeToFile

        public void writeToFile(Track t)
        Writes a single jsoul track to a MIDI file, using the file name specified in the MidiFile's constructor.
        Parameters:
        t - the Track to be written

      • writeToFile

        public void writeToFile(Sequence s)
        Writes a jsoul Sequence to a MIDI file, using the file name specified in the MidiFile's constructor.
        Parameters:
        s - the Sequence to be written

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears the MIDI file of all content, if the file exists in the system.

      • getSequence

        public Sequence getSequence()
        Will convert the file (if it exists in the system) into a jsoul-compatible Sequence that can be modified using jsoul's API. Currently is only guaranteed to work on files that were originally created with jsoul.
        Returns:
        the jsoul Sequence generated from the file

      • append

        public void append(Sequence s)
        Appends a given Sequence to the end of an existing MIDI file, and writing the result to a new file. Will only work if the original file and provided sequence have the same number of tracks.
        Parameters:
        s - The sequence to append.
